definitions.definition: to do or achieve what was hoped for or expected

examples.text: He amply fulfilled the weight of expectation that they had placed on him.
The building is still fulfilling its original purpose admirably.
The movie doesn't quite fulfil its promise.
Türkiye is a market that has never quite fulfilled its potential.
Fulfil your dreams with a new career.

definitions.definition: to do or have what is required or necessary

examples.text: to **fulfil the terms/conditions** of an agreement
No candidate fulfils all the criteria for this position.
He had fulfilled his promise to his father.
Once they had fulfilled their obligations, they were allowed to go.
Failure to fulfil the terms of the agreements may result in legal action.
Work permits are only given to people who fulfil certain criteria.

definitions.definition: to have a particular role or purpose

examples.text: Nursery schools should **fulfil the function** of preparing children for school.

definitions.definition: to make somebody feel happy and satisfied with what they are doing or have done

examples.text: I need a job that really fulfils me.
He was able to fulfil himself through his painting.

definitions.definition: to pack and send something that a customer has ordered

examples.text: We aim to fulfil all orders within seven days.
Huge demand led to customers waiting weeks to see their orders finally fulfilled.

wordOrigin: late Old English fullfyllan ‘fill up, make full’ (see full, fill).
